p: The essential oil of T. vulgare obtained by steam distillation method was yellow with a distinct odor. The extraction yield obtained after 3 h was 0.23% ( w/ w). The refraction index was 1.4797, and the density measured using pycnometer was 0.92396 g·mL −1. Table 1 presents the chemical composition of the essential oil as determined by GC-FID analysis. The oil was mainly comprised of oxygenated monoterpenes such as camphor (30.48%), borneol (14.80%), and 1,8-cineole (10.80%). The essential oil also contained camphene (7.29%), bornyl acetate (5.53%), and α-pinene (4.43%). Our results confirm the findings of Collin et al. [ 17] for T. vulgare essential oil from northern Quebec.
